outcome: Branch A: The Consensus Confrontation – Facing the Truth. Public assemblies form as both ordinary and restored citizens are called to debate and reconcile, while the BCI ranks participants by honesty and empathy. Cracks in restored identities begin to show, revealing a deeper layer to Halden's plan and the cost of algorithmic governance.

events.description: Public assemblies are held in every district, open to all, where ordinary and restored citizens recount personal histories and debate the system's failings. The BCI ranks speakers, projecting their honesty and empathy scores for all to see.
Biases in the BCI's scoring begin to surface, particularly with restored citizens whose recall stutters or seems artificial. Tensions rise as some are accused of being less 'real' than others.

A previously restored citizen publicly breaks down, revealing memories imposed by the BCI. A wave of similar confessions sweeps through the city, leading to mass questioning of every personal and official narrative.

A collection of first-hand testimonies, both verified and disputed, are collated into a new digital 'book' of Stenograd. For the first time, the city openly debates how much of the recorded history can be trusted.
